verses.verse: (1 The holy Ghost calleth all men to the consideration of man’s life,7 showing them not to be most blessed that are most wealthy, and therefore not to be feared: but contrariwise he lifteth up our minds to consider how all things are ruled by God’s providence:14 Who as he judgeth these worldly misers to everlasting torments,15 so doth he preserve his, and will reward them in the day of the resurrection, 590 1:6. ) Hear this all ye people: give ear, all ye that dwell in the world,
As well low as high, both rich and poor.
My mouth shall speak of wisdom, and the meditation of mine heart is of knowledge.
I will incline mine ear to a parable, and utter my grave matter upon the harp.

Wherefore should I (Though wickedness reign, and enemies rage, seeing God will execute his judgments against the wicked in time convenient.) fear in the evil days, when iniquity shall compass me about, as at mine heels?
They trust in their (To trust in riches is mere madness, seeing they can neither restore life, nor prolong it.) goods, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.
Yet a man can by no means redeem his brother: he cannot give his ransom to God,

(So (That is, so rare or not to be found, as prophecy was precious in the days of Eli, 1 Sam. 3:1.) precious is the redemption of their souls, (Meaning, it is impossible to live forever: also that life and death are only in God’s hands.) and the continuance forever)
That he may live still forever, and not see the grave.

For he seeth that wise men (In that that death maketh no difference between the persons.) die: and also that the ignorant and foolish perish, and leave their riches for (That is, not to their children, but to strangers. Yet the wicked profit not by these examples, but still dream an immortality in earth.) others.
Yet they think their houses and their habitations shall continue forever, even from generation to generation, and (Or, labor that their name may be famous in earth.) call their lands by their names.
But man shall not continue in honor; he is like the (As touching the death of the body.) beasts that die.
This their way uttereth their foolishness; yet their posterity (They speak and do the same thing that their fathers did.) delight in their talk. Selah.

(As sheep are gathered into the fold, so shall they be brought to the grave.) Like sheep they lie in grave; (Because they have no part of life everlasting.) death devoureth them; and the righteous shall have domination over them in the (Christ’s coming is as the morning, when the elect shall reign with Christ their head over the wicked.) morning; for their beauty shall consume, when they shall go from their house to grave.
But God shall deliver my soul from the power of the grave; (Or, because he hath received me.) for he will receive me. Selah.
Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, and when the glory of his house is increased.
(Cross references: : Job 27:19; 1 Tim. 6:7) For he shall take nothing away, when he dieth, neither shall his pomp descend after him.
For while he lived, (Hebrew, he blessed his soul.) he rejoiced himself; and (The flatterers praise them that live in delight and pleasures.) men will praise thee, when thou makest much of thyself.

He shall enter into the generation of his fathers, (Both they and their fathers shall live here but a while, and at length die forever.) and they shall not live forever. (Or, his soul.) (And not pass the term appointed for life.)

Man is in honor; and (He condemneth man’s ingratitude, who having received excellent gifts of God, abuseth them like a beast to his own condemnation.) understandeth not; he is like to beasts that perish.
